author: Lusa
title: Seca. Falta de água no Algarve é "pior de sempre" mesmo após as chuvas
text:
"É verdade que as chuvas de janeiro e fevereiro trouxeram alguma água para as albufeiras do Algarve e isso é uma boa notícia, mas estamos piores do que no passado e estamos na pior situação de sempre na região", disse aquele responsável.
José Pimenta Machado falava na inauguração de uma exposição dedicada ao Dia Mundial da Água, que marca também o lançamento do projeto do Museu Nacional e Arquivo dos Recursos Hídricos, a instalar numa antiga fábrica de papel no Rio Caima, em Valmaior, Albergaria-a-Velha (Aveiro).
Embora o país esteja hoje, em média, com as albufeiras a 87%, referiu, persistem os problemas no litoral alentejano e no Algarve, e no futuro a previsão é a de que haja menos água, advertiu o vice-presidente da APA.
Para aquele responsável, antes de tudo, é preciso agir para haver uma gestão da água mais eficiente, sem prejuízo de se avançar com novas barragens.
"Não faz sentido nenhum ter uma rede em que se perde 50% ou 60% da água", criticou, defendendo que "a primeira prioridade deve ser dada à eficiência dos sistemas".
É que não basta ter mais barragens, se elas não tiverem água e exemplificou: "temos de aumentar reservas de água, mas temos hoje três barragens que ainda estão a menos de 20%, sendo duas no Algarve e uma no Alentejo".
No caso particular do Algarve, a solução para o vice-presidente da APA está na dessalinização da água do mar, sendo essa a outra aposta que tem de se fazer.
"Vamos fazer a primeira grande central de dessalinização na zona do Algarve, em Albufeira [distrito de Faro], e é tão importante para a região", sublinhou José Pimenta Machado.
O dirigente lembrou que Portugal foi o primeiro país europeu a ter uma central de dessalinização, na ilha do Porto Santo, na região da Madeira, que "funciona bem" e é "muito importante" para a ilha.
Pimenta Machado visitou em Albergaria-a-Velha a reabilitação de uma vala hidráulica em São João de Loure e a exposição "Recursos Hídricos: História, Sociedade e Saber".
O Algarve está em situação de alerta devido à seca desde 05 de fevereiro, tendo o Governo aprovado um conjunto de medidas de restrição ao consumo, nomeadamente a redução de 15% no setor urbano, incluindo o turismo, e de 25% na agricultura.
A estas medidas somam-se outras como o combate às perdas nas redes de abastecimento, a utilização de água tratada na rega de espaços verdes, ruas e campos de golfe ou a suspensão da atribuição de títulos de utilização de recursos hídricos.
O Governo já admitiu elevar o nível das restrições, declarando o estado de emergência ambiental ou de calamidade, caso as medidas agora implementadas sejam insuficientes para fazer face à escassez hídrica na região.

author: CBCP News
title: CBCP head shares 5 reasons why Filipinos should watch ‘GomBurZa’
text: The head of the Catholic Bishops’ Conference of the Philippines (CBCP) shared important reasons why “GomBurZa” is a must-watch historical biographical film. READ: [‘Tagos sa puso’: Chel Diokno ‘proud dad’ after watching ‘GomBurZa’ directed by son Pepe](https://interaksyon.philstar.com/trends-spotlights/2023/12/25/267455/chel-diokno-proud-dad-gomburza-pepe-diokno/) | [More screening of ‘Firefly,’ ‘GomBurZa’ sought after MMFF 2023 wins](https://interaksyon.philstar.com/hobbies-interests/2023/12/28/267690/more-screening-firefly-gomburza-sought-mmff-2023/) Bishop Pablo Virgilio David, CBCP president, shared his insight in a social media post regarding one of the 10 entries in this year’s prestigious Metro Manila Film Festival (MMFF). He outlined his points via his Facebook page and gave five reasons why every Filipino must watch the movie. Well-researched film David shared that the film will bring back the audience to the “first spark of patriotism” that shaped the Filipino identity. He said the film beautifully portrayed how diverse groups, including Tagalogs, Kapampangans, Ilocanos, Cebuanos, natives, mestizos, criollos, and more, coalesced into one nation in the late 1800s. Produced by JesCom, world-class director The CBCP head said the fact the film is produced by the Jesuit Communications Foundation is reason alone to anticipate its quality. He also praised its director, Joses Lorenzo “Pepe” Diokno, acknowledging him as a world-class talent. GomBurZa also won the 49th MMFF’s Best Director award for Diokno. Gripping retelling of martyrdom story David explained the movie is “a gripping retelling of the story of martyrdom of these three secular priests from the perspective of a young witness—Jose Rizal y Mercado, who was mentored by his brother Paciano, who in turn was mentored by Padre Jose Burgos, and who, in turn was also mentored by Padre Pedro Pelaez. Rizal, in later years, honored these priests in his novel “El Filibusterismo.” ‘Class A’ David said “GomBurZa” movie “is class A in all regards, in terms of quality as a film production, in terms of acting, directing, screenplay, research, cinematography, sounds, etc.” “GomBurZa” is the most awarded MMFF movie this year. Aside from Best Director, the movie won Best Actor for Cedrick Juan, Best Sound, Best Production Design, Best Cinematography, Gatpuno Antonio J. Villegas Cultural Award, and second Best Picture. GomBurZa unveils essence of being true Filipino GomBurZa tells the story of three Filipino priests Mariano Gómes, José Burgos, and Jacinto Zamora, who were executed during the Spanish colonial era in the Philippines. The film stars Dante Rivero as Padre Gomez, Cedrick Juan as Padre Burgos, and Enchong Dee as Padre Zamora. The bishop said the movie “will make you appreciate what it truly means to be a Filipino.”

author: Piri Medya A.Ş.
title: US aircraft maker Boeing's workers reject contract in overwhelming vote, set to strike | America
text:
Over 30,000 employees of the US aircraft maker Boeing were set to strike on Friday, bringing most of the aircraft production to a halt after the company's staff overwhelmingly rejected a new labor contract.
Workers in the US state of Oregon and the Seattle area in Washington voted 94.6% against a tentative agreement presented Sunday by Boeing and the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers, according to CNBC.
They also voted 96% in favor of a strike, significantly surpassing the two-thirds majority needed to initiate a work stoppage.
“We strike at midnight,” IAM District 751 President Jon Holden announced during a press conference revealing the vote results.
Holden described it as an "unfair labor practice strike," claiming that factory workers had faced "discriminatory conduct, coercive questioning, unlawful surveillance and we had unlawful promise of benefits."
He added that Boeing must negotiate in good faith.
Boeing did not provide an immediate response.
The proposed agreement offered 25% wage increases and enhancements to health-care and retirement benefits, though the union had pushed for raises of around 40%. Workers criticized the deal, arguing it did not adequately address rising living costs.

author: ABC News
title: A paramilitary group at war with Sudan’s military endorses a cease-fire during holy fasting month - ABC News
text: A paramilitary group at war with Sudan’s military endorses a cease-fire during holy fasting month A Sudanese paramilitary group battling the country’s military in a nearly yearlong ruinous conflict has endorsed a resolution by the U.N. Security Council calling for a cease-fire during the Muslim holy month of Ramadan CAIRO -- A Sudanese paramilitary group battling the country’s military in a nearly yearlong ruinous conflict endorsed Saturday a resolution by the U.N. Security Council calling for a cease-fire during the Muslim holy month of Ramadan. The group, known as the Rapid Support Forces, said in a statement that it hopes the resolution, adopted by the U.N. Security Council on Friday, would help deliver crucially needed humanitarian assistance to millions of Sudanese trapped in the fighting across the Northeastern African country. Ramadan, during which adult Muslims are required to fast from dawn to sunset, is expected to start on or around Monday, depending on the sighting of the crescent moon. The RSF said it views the initiative as a “crucial opportunity” for the warring parties to embark on negotiations to find a political settlement to the conflict. “We view this as a crucial opportunity to initiate earnest discussions that could catalyze a political pathway. This pathway must culminate in a durable ceasefire, foster security and stability, and result in a substantive resolution that addresses the foundational issues of the historical crisis in Sudan,” it said. Sudan's military has already supported a call by U.N. Secretary-General Antonio Guterres for a Ramadan cease-fire. In his Thursday appeal, Guterres warned Thursday that the conflict threatens Sudan’s unity and “could ignite regional instability of dramatic proportions.” Sudan plunged into chaos in April last year, when long-simmering tensions between its military, led by Gen. Abdel Fattah Burhan, and the Rapid Support Forces paramilitary commanded by Mohammed Hamdan Dagalo broke into street battles in the capital, Khartoum. The fighting broke out during Ramadan last year. Fighting spread to other parts of the country, especially urban areas, but in Sudan’s western Darfur region it took on a different form, with brutal attacks by the Arab-dominated Rapid Support Forces on ethnic African civilians. Thousands of people have been killed. The 15-member Security Council voted overwhelmingly in favor of the British-drafted cease-fire resolution, with 14 countries in support and only Russia abstaining. The resolution expressed “grave concern over the spreading violence and the catastrophic and deteriorating humanitarian situation, including crisis levels, or worse, of acute [food](https://abcnews.go.com/alerts/Food) insecurity, particularly in Darfur.” The head of the World Food Program, Cindy McCain, said earlier this week that the conflict risks creating the world’s largest hunger crisis, with some 18 million people across Sudan facing acute hunger, including 5 million who face starvation. The conflict has uprooted more than 10 million people either to safer areas inside Sudan or to neighboring countries, according to U.N. agencies. South Sudan received 600,000 people who fled the fighting in Sudan.

author: Jim Seimas
title: Johnny Cornejo helps Aptos survive Soquel in tournament thriller | Boys basketball
text:
SANTA CRUZ — That must-see high school basketball rivalry between Aptos and Santa Cruz has company.
Soquel gave the Mariners all they could handle in the consolation championship at the 10th annual Aptos High/Santa Cruz Warriors NorCal Invitational on Saturday, before Johnny Cornejo pieced together a four-minute stretch that he and fans likely won’t forget anytime soon.
Cornejo scored 11 of Aptos’ 14 points in overtime, and the Mariners knocked off the Knights 60-53 at Kaiser Permanente Arena, home of the Santa Cruz Warriors, the Golden State Warriors’ NBA G League affiliate.
“It was a good team win,” Cornejo said. “We all won together, we all contributed as a team. We moved the ball around well.”
Asked to assess his overtime, he added: “It’s amazing. It’s a time to remember. You don’t get those times (often). You can’t take it for granted.”
The teams still have, at least, two meetings this season in Santa Cruz Coast Athletic League play: Jan. 9 in Aptos and Jan. 26 in Soquel. And they could meet play in the SCCAL Tournament. Mark you calendars.
“Soquel brings it every time,” Cornejo said. “We’ve got to bring it right back on the defensive end. That’s how we win games. Our defense is the key to us winning. And then it’s offense, after the defense.”
Cornejo finished with 19 points. He scored his team’s first nine points in the extra stanza. Mateo Calfee, an all-tournament selection, made three free throws in overtime and finished with a team-high 21 points.
Soquel’s Braylon Noble scored all seven of his team’s points in overtime and finished with 21 points. Tyler Harway scored 15 points. Center-turned-guard Cade Petersen, who is 6-foot-2, 230 pounds, finished with 11 points — all in the second half. He made three of his team’s 11 3s.
“That kinda changes the scouting report on Cade, doesn’t it?” Mariners coach Brian Bowyer said. “He’s knocking ’em down. And when he missed them, they look good. Every shot that comes out of his hand looks good.”
Aptos (9-5) played without star Isaiah Ackerman, who missed his second straight game with an ankle sprain.
Soquel was without ill Nico Ramirez, and vacationing Peyton Bortz and Liam Wennstrom.
“Wait til you see what comes,” Knights coach Greg Baskovich said of his absent players. “It’s all perimeter coming.”
The Knights (5-8) also saw Steeley Deans suffer a likely concussion after he collided with Cornejo while pursuing a loose ball in the final seconds of the first half.
“I expect this is what it’s going to be with them every game,” Mariners coach Brian Bowyer said. “It’s going to be nip-and-tuck, it’s going to be tight. It’s fun and it’s the way high school basketball is supposed to be. These guys will remember this game. It’s just fun basketball.”
Calfee made a couple of layups that helped Aptos jump out to an 11-0 lead. Harway banked in a 3-pointer and made a layup as Soquel closed the quarter with an 8-3 run.
Aptos outscored Soquel 13-11 in the second quarter and carried a 27-19 lead into the half. Noble scored all 11 points for the Knights.
Cade Peterson made a 3, Harway made two layups, and Jones buried a 3 to knot the score at 29-all in the third quarter.
“We always come back,” Baskovich said. “We always start slow. I don’t know what it is.”
Aptos responded with an 8-0 run to enter the fourth leading 37-29.
Soquel, fueled by four 3s, went on a 16-1 run to take a seven-point lead, 45-38, with 54.7 second remaining. But Aptos adjusted to Soquel’s zone defense and closed regulation with a 8-1 run — Cornejo made a 3-pointer and Calfee made and-one basket and two free throws.
Both teams missed a 3-point shot over the final 9.8 seconds.
Four minutes were added to the game clock for overtime. Soquel won the jump ball but turned the ball over on a shot-clock violation. That was the cue for Cornejo to take the game over.
He made four free throws, two layups, and a 3-pointer. After his 3, he held three fingers up so everyone could admire the hottest hand in the facility.
“He just steps up in big times for us, when we need shots,” Bowyer said. “He’s kinda one of those very streaky players. He can go a quarter and a half and not even get a shot up. But when he feels it, when he makes a shot, he can get going. And you could tell he felt it.”
Bowyer was concerned with Soquel heading into the game, and the Knights validated his belief. They had five players join the team late after helping their school’s football team win the CIF 4-AA State Championship on Dec. 8.
“The longer this season goes, the better Soquel is going to be,” Bowyer said. “And they’re just going to keep getting better and better. They’re already good.”
Baskovich’s team was on the losing end, but he was in good spirits after the setback.
“I just told them I’m really proud,” he said. “We’re getting better.”

author: SBT
title: Brasil bate recorde na geração de energia, com alta de 18,7%
text: Brasil bate recorde na geração de energia, com alta de 18,7% Dados foram divulgados pela Aneel nesta quinta-feira (18) O Brasil encerrou o primeiro semestre de 2024 com uma alta de 5,7 gigawatts (GW) de potência instalada na matriz elétrica, o que corresponde a um aumento de 18,7% na geração de energia, em relação ao primeiro semestre de 2023, e um recorde na série histórica, iniciada há 27 anos. Segundo dados da Agência Nacional de Energia Elétrica (Aneel), divulgados nesta quinta-feira (18), 168 novas usinas entraram em funcionamento nos seis primeiros meses de 2024. Somente em junho, 27 unidades começaram a operar, sendo 13 eólicas, 10 fotovoltaicas e quatro termelétricas. [+ Conta de luz fica mais cara em julho](https://sbtnews.sbt.com.br/noticia/economia/conta-de-luz-fica-mais-cara-a-partir-desta-segunda-feira) Apesar dos dados positivos, a previsão da Aneel é de que a geração de energia elétrica tenha um crescimento de 10,1 gigawatts, menor do que a alta registrada no ano anterior, de 10,3 GW. Fontes renováveis De acordo com a Aneel, a quantidade máxima de produção de energia no Brasil é de 203,8 GW. Dessa capacidade total das usinas em operação, 84,6% são de fontes renováveis. As quatro maiores fontes renováveis na composição da matriz de energia elétrica brasileira são a hídrica (53,88%), eólica (15,22%), biomassa (8,31%) e solar (7,2%). Já entre as não renováveis, as mais expressivas são gás natural (8,78%), petróleo (3,92%) e carvão mineral (1,7%).

author: Ryan Bradshaw
title: The Future of Education: Embracing Technology and Innovation
text: The schooling environment is set for a revolutionary shift guided by rapid advancements and progress. This includes virtual reality classrooms and AI-driven personalized learning experiences, amongst others. These tools channel greater interactivity and deeper engagement. They push a vital transformation to equip students for a [tech-centric](https://www.apollotechnical.com/optimizing-it-infrastructure-for-energy-efficiency-a-2024-guide/) future. This also quickly addresses global disparities related to quality education. Virtual Reality: Immersive Learning Environments VR can transform how knowledge is absorbed by taking students to realms beyond their imagination. It can enable a journey to ancient civilizations, human organs, and even outer space. The best part is that all this is possible from the comfort of a desk. An immersive approach quickly captures attention and dramatically improves comprehension of complex subjects. It also channels more meaningful engagement with the curriculum and relevant topics. Artificial Intelligence: Personalizing the Learning Experience By examining learning habits and performance, [AI systems](https://www.apollotechnical.com/ai-in-recruitment-prioritizing-the-human-in-human-resources/) can adapt educational content to suit each student’s requirements. Let’s suppose that a child finds a particular algebra concept challenging. In that case, the tool can modify the difficulty level or recommend extra resources. It can also help break down the theory and practical parts to help make the content more digestible. This comprehensive approach ensures that each learner gets support aligned with their ability and pace. Management Tools: Streamlining Administrative Tasks [Online school management software](https://www.teachngo.com/) is revolutionizing the daily operations of educational institutions. These platforms can also easily handle various tasks. This includes student registration, attendance/grade tracking, and even facilitating communication between teachers and parents. Automating these duties means schools can allocate more time and resources to teaching. This enhances overall efficiency and productivity, quickly boosting outcomes. Augmented Reality: Boosting Real-World Understanding AR adds a new dimension of interactiveness to conventional settings by overlaying digital content onto the physical world. With these applications, students can view 3D models of geographical landscapes or historical artifacts right on their desks. This quickly turns abstract ideas into concrete experiences. The best part is that these sessions also boost engagement to the maximum. They can be particularly helpful for topics that are hard to grasp without visually captivating content. Online Learning Platforms: Expanding Access to Education Remote solutions have made various materials more accessible to learners worldwide. These also allow easy participation in courses that were previously out of reach. Most outlets also offer a wide range of resources. These include foundational academic classes and even specialized skills training. The best part is that these are available at any time and place. This flexibility quickly caters to various learning styles and schedules. It effectively dismantles geographical and [socio-economic](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/social-economics.asp) barriers, boosting knowledgeability. Big Data: Tailoring Education to Student Needs Through collecting and analyzing extensive datasets on student performance, educational tools can pinpoint trends and patterns. These can guide superior teaching methods and curriculum modifications. This strategy also enables educators to tackle inequalities easily. It helps foster an all-inclusive environment where everyone has a chance at success. Endnote Digital advancements are quickly enhancing accessibility and adaptability. Looking ahead, these will continue to play a crucial role in crafting a more dynamic educational environment.

title: Air Canada demande un arbitrage obligatoire | «Je suis absolument contre» -Michèle Boisvert — 98.5 Montréal
text: En raison du conflit entre Air Canada et ses pilotes, il pourrait y avoir une grève ou un lock-out le 18 septembre, si aucun accord n'est trouvé pour le renouvellement de la convention collective. Écoutez Michèle Boisvert commenter la situation au micro de Philippe Cantin. La direction d'Air Canada a demandé jeudi au gouvernement fédéral un arbitrage obligatoire avant le conflit, une démarche qui a déjà été utilisée en 2011 et 2012, sous les conservateurs, avec Lisa Raitt. «Je suis absolument contre», note Michèle Boisvert. «Non, vraiment... Avant même le déclenchement? Je me pose une sérieuse question: est-ce que Air Canada est vraiment un service essentiel? «Lorsque le gouvernement a décidé d'appliquer l'article 107 pour la grève dans le rail, j'ai salué, parce que, premièrement, la grève avait été déclenchée. Là, c'était les deux compagnies (CN et CP) en même temps, et vraiment, c'était une paralysie de l'économie. C'est quelque chose d'exceptionnel d'utiliser cet article. Là, on le demande avant même qu'il n'y une ait grève, Je trouve qu'on exagère.»

These efforts can be helped along by those with knowledge about important issues, who take the time to explain them in such a manner, that little expertise is necessary to figure out the basis of the matter at hand.
